column4: I need the 2.6.10 kernel source but synaptic doesnt have it in its database, where can i get the ubunti 2.6.10 kernel source.
Hoary?
i have all the repositories in allready.
OK but I was asking what you are running.  You aren't on Warty are you?
I dont know waht warty is, so I dont think so.
From a terminal try this: "apt-cache dump |grep kernel-tree-2.6"
I did that and didnt get any output response.
Sorry, that should be "kernel-source-2.6"
Package: kernel-source-2.6.1
Please don't post in here :-)
Are you sure you aren't running Warty?
im running the Hoary Hedgehog release
That is strange, you should at least have 2.6.10
If you do "uname -i" what kernel version are you running currently?
Then you have to be able to get the source.
I looked all over synaptic. Can i get it off of the ubuntu website?
Have you done an update?
yeah
Did you find the source?
nope :(
